snippet: In Chelyabinsk, which was hit by a meteor in 2013, snow on the ground turned blue. But residents were reassured that there was no cause for alarm.
abstract: Residents of Chelyabinsk, Russia, are alarmed by sight of blue-colored snow on ground, until officials reassure them that powdered dye meant for coloring Easter eggs spilled from factory ventilation system; sand from Sahara carried by cyclone and sprinkled over southern Russia had created orange snow 10 days earlier.
lead_paragraph: In Chelyabinsk, which was hit by a meteor in 2013, snow on the ground turned blue. But residents were reassured that there was no cause for alarm.

headline.main: Multicolored Snow in Russia? No Worries, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Russians Don’t Always Need a Weatherman to Explain Multicolored Snow
